oh my, that's kind of cool.

So it's trying to hack out URLs from the JavaS=
cript. 

Does this kind of crawling bother webmasters. When they review the=
ir
error logs they will see hits by the crawler on URLs that don't exist.

=
Is this acceptable practice? Using Google as reference, I don't think
I've =
ever seen a GoogleBot trigger 404 errors on the server. Not
unless the HTML=
 had bad links.

Should I remove the JavaScript Link-Extractor if I'm going=
 to be
crawling public websites?

> those "X" links are speculative links f=
ound by the JavaScript 
> Link-Extractor (Or maybe even caused be Aggressiv=
eExtractorHTML).
> Scroll down to the bottom of your websites source code a=
nd you will
find 
> something like:
> 
> { coded =3D "wOGq0Z@..."
> 
> This=
 is what caused this false positive.
